subject: Sleep
title: Replay and Consolidation Waves
description: A quick win: understand Replay and Consolidation Waves.

hook.text: Rats running a maze by day replay the exact same neural sequences at high speed during sleep.

buildup.text: These replay events happen during sharp-wave ripples, brief bursts of activity in the hippocampus.

discovery.text: Ripples compress hours of waking experience into milliseconds, broadcasting them to the cortex for storage.

twist.text: Disrupting ripples during sleep prevents memory consolidation. The replay is not optional; it's the mechanism.

climax.text: Sleep replay doesn't just copy memories. It reorganizes them, integrating new data with existing knowledge.

punchline.text: Your brain speed-runs the day's lessons while you sleep.

quiz.question: What are sharp-wave ripples in the hippocampus?
options: Brief bursts that replay and consolidate memories during sleep
